alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Fillmore; Mower; Olmsted (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 24 at 2:41PM CST until January 25 at 9:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST TUESDAY, THEN FROM 9 AM TUESDAY TO NOON CST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 9 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north-central Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM to 9 AM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 6 AM Tuesday, then from 9 AM Tuesday to noon CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills will hover around 35 below zero for a few hours Tuesday morning, prompting the Wind Chill Warning. Depending on winds, another Wind Chill Warning may be needed Tuesday night if it looks like wind chills may be colder than 35 below zero.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
